value.title: Is my data secure in Power BI? Part 1: How data is stored. 游댏
value.excerpt: If you are considering using Power BI, you might have asked yourself: Is my data secure in Power BI?  That is what we are going to talk about on this video: We will discuss the different methods available for you to get data in Power BI.  We will then discuss two critical topics:  What is data in transit?

value.excerpt: In today's video I will show you how to lookup a value in the same table using power Query. value.title: Pushing the Power BI buttons 游녡
value.excerpt: You haven't missed the Power Bi April 2018 update right?  My favourite feature is by far the new buttons! With Power Bi buttons you can create all kinds of experiences, like buttons to change charts, as I show in this demo.  What is your favourite Power BI april 2018 update? Let me know in the comment

value.title: Refer to a value, column or row in Power Query
value.excerpt: Have you ever tried to use a specific column, row or value in power query, but didnt now how to do it?  In this video I will show you how to refer to a specific column, row or value using simple commands in power query.   Looking for a download file? Go to our Download Center: https://curbal.com/donwload-center

value.title: Running totals by subcategory in Power Query!!
value.excerpt: I showed you on last monday's video: https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=uX3_dnb5on0 how to do running totals in power query, and in this video I will show you how to do it but by subcategory or group.  Fingers crossed I managed to explain myself!! :)  Here you can download all the pbix files: https://curbal.com/donwload-center

value.title: Running totals in power query??? Yes, you can :)
value.excerpt: In today's video, I am going to show you how you can do running totals or cummulative totals in Power Query, but do this only if you have no way to do it using DAX.  Also, I will show you how List.Range work, really cool function :)  Here you can download all the pbix files: https://curbal.com/donwload-center

value.title: Schedule data downloads / exports in Power BI
value.excerpt: You can export data or download data out of Power BI in many different ways and depending on the source, you can schedule refresh those data dumps too.   In this video, I will give you one example on how to do that.  Other resources mentioned in this video: Export data with DAX Studio: https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=-Gfgnk6R0Qw

value.title: Working hours without Holidays, weekends and by country in power query

I walk through the 3 main steps to perform the takeover. Doing the takeover doesn't cost you anything. For more detail on the cost of Power
